original: don rnam pa gzhan du na yul rnams la chags pa med pa'i lam ni sbyin pa ste /
analyzed: don rnam pa gzhan du na yul rnams la chags pa med pa'i lam ni sbyin pa ste /

original: gtong ba la goms pas chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtong ba la goms pas chags pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, through familiarity with giving, one becomes free of attachment.

original: de ltar sbyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mo //
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi lam mo //
translated: Thus, generosity is the path of the bodhisattvas.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa gzhan dag kyang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the other perfections should be explained as appropriate.

original: bsam gtan gyi yon tan la goms pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan nyid yon tan yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi yon tan la goms pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan nyid yon tan yin te /
translated: Through familiarity with the virtues of meditative absorption, means that meditative absorption itself is a virtue,

original: yon tan gzhan thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gzhan thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //

original: de bas na de la goms pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de la goms pa'o //

original: rna ba dang snying tshim par byed pa'i tshig yin te /

original: mi gsal ba med pa ste /

analyzed: de yang gsung rgya che bas rnar snyan pas yongs su tshim par byed pa yin no //

analyzed: rna ba dang snying tshim par byed pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni snyan par ston pa yin te /

analyzed: skad snyan cing 'khor yongs su tshim par byed pas grong khyer pa'i snyan pa'i @244b tshig gis brjod do //

analyzed: de bas na rna ba dang snying tshim par byed pas zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'jebs par ston te /

analyzed: des na yang chos dang chos ma yin pa rab tu 'byed pa la mkhas pa nyid do //

original: de ltar mdo'i tshig gi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar mdo'i tshig gi rjes su 'brang ba yin te /
translated: Thus, he follows the words of the s≈´tra.

analyzed: tshig brgyad po 'di'i go rims kyis yang dag par bstan te /

original: 'dis ni ngag gi las phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ngag gi las phun sum tshogs pa bstan to //

original: rigs dang gzugs kyi yon tan las //
analyzed: rigs dang gzugs kyi yon tan las //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: sa gzhi bzang po zhes bya ba ni yang thog gi rtsig pa dkar gyis bskus pa la zla ba'i 'od zer bab pa bzhin no //

analyzed: chos kyi gnyen po dang 'dom pa'i phyir te chos dang 'gal ba dang / phyogs rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di bstan pa yin no //

translated: With reference to the Dharma as an antidote and a companion,üîΩthere are four verses beginning with

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs bcad bzhi yin te /

translated: The phrase he is a minister who is privy to the king's thoughts means that he is a confidant.

original: spyan sngar brim du rung ba zhes bya ba ni lhan cig smra ba dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i gtam byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: spyan sngar brim du rung ba zhes bya ba ni lhan cig smra ba dang / rab tu dga' bar bya ba'i gtam byar rung ba'o //

original: bde ba'i rgyu ni bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu ni bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase he is one who is a source of happiness means that he is one who brings about happiness.

original: bde ba'i rgyu nyid yon tan yin pas bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan to //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu nyid yon tan yin pas bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan to //
translated: The phrase he is one who possesses the qualities that bring about happiness means that he is one who possesses the qualities that bring about happiness.

original: bde ba'i rgyu'am khyad par du gyur pa'i bde ba skyed pa'i rkyen ni mchog go //
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu'am khyad par du gyur pa'i bde ba skyed pa'i rkyen ni mchog go //
translated: The phrase he is one who is a condition that brings about a special kind of happiness means that he is one who is a condition that brings about a special kind of happiness.

original: de bas na sngar gyi bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan nyid khyad par du gyur pa de thos na bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan mchog thos pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na sngar gyi bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan nyid khyad par du gyur pa de thos na bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan mchog thos pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase he is one who hears about the special qualities that bring about happiness means that he is one who hears about the special qualities that bring about happiness.

original: de bas na de gnyis mchi ba lags te /
analyzed: de bas na de gnyis mchi ba lags te /
translated: Therefore, the phrase he is one who is summoned by them means that he is one who is summoned by them.

original: bde ba'i gzhir gyur pas 'gugs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i gzhir gyur pas 'gugs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the basis for their happiness, he is summoned by them.

original: bde ba la gnas par 'dod pa'i dbang gis ni gang gi phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la gnas par 'dod pa'i dbang gis ni gang gi phyir /
translated: By the power of desiring to abide in happiness,

original: tshangs ba'i 'jig rten du skyes ba las kyang rigs par mthong @265a * //
analyzed: tshangs ba'i 'jig rten du skyes ba las kyang rigs par mthong @265a * //

original: ba'o ; / bka' mchid gda' ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan ston pa yin no //
analyzed: ba'o ; / bka' mchid gda' ba zhes bya ba ni bde bar 'gyur ba'i yon tan ston pa yin no //
translated: The phrase to have a conversation indicates the teaching of the qualities of happiness.

original: yon tan khyad par can du 'phags shing bzang ba'i zhes bya ba ni de las mchog tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan khyad par can du 'phags shing bzang ba'i zhes bya ba ni de las mchog tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The phrase excellent and superior qualities means that they are superior to those.

original: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya ba yang ci nas kyang bya ba'i rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa sbyin pa'i sgra bsgrags pa zhes bya ba yang ci nas kyang bya ba'i rigs pa yin no //
translated: The phrase the sound of giving fearlessness also means that it is reasonable to do whatever is necessary.

original: bde ba'i yo byad kyi yon tan khyad par can thos nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i yo byad kyi yon tan khyad par can thos nas zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Having heard the special qualities of the requisites of happiness, one should understand as previously explained.

original: lha gcig sems can phal cher ni //
analyzed: lha gcig sems can phal cher ni //
translated: The verse that begins Most sentient beings, O god,

original: de la 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dren pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i me tog ni me tog rnam pa mang po'o//

original: zhes bya ba de'i lan ni /

analyzed: mi bzod pa spangs pas rang bzhin dul bar gyur pa'o //

analyzed: 'byung po nyes pa'i gcong rong mi 'dong ngo //

original: zhes bya ba yin te /

analyzed: gzhan rag lus pa'i phan yon yin no //

original: zla ba'i 'od las gsal ba'i yon tan ni //
analyzed: zla ba'i 'od las gsal ba'i yon tan ni //

analyzed: phan par 'dod cing yon tan dga' ba yin //
translated: They want to help and delight in good qualities.

original: skye bo gnod gtsang 'dra la smos ci dgos //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: skye bo gnod gtsang 'dra la smos ci dgos // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: What need is there to mention those who are both helpful and pure?

original: @276a * // 'di gsum gyis ni phyi rol gyi snod dang 'dra bar chos nyan pa rnams kyi nyes pa gsum med par ston te /
analyzed: @276a * // 'di gsum gyis ni phyi rol gyi snod dang 'dra bar chos nyan pa rnams kyi nyes pa gsum med par ston te /
translated: These three verses show that those who listen to the teaching are like the external container.

original: gang gi phyir snod 'di gsum la char bab kyang don med pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snod 'di gsum la char bab kyang don med pa nyid de /
translated: Because if rain falls on these three kinds of containers, it is wasted.

original: bsil ba dang phan pa yin yang chu mi 'jug pa dang / gang du chu 'jug kyang mi gtsang bas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang du chu zhugs kyang snod rdol bas mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: bsil ba dang phan pa yin yang chu mi 'jug pa dang / gang du chu 'jug kyang mi gtsang bas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang du chu zhugs kyang snod rdol bas mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The rain does not enter the first container, even though it is cool and refreshing; the rain enters the second container, but it is spoiled by impurities; and the rain enters the third container, but it does not stay because the container leaks.

original: de ltar nyan pa'i skye bo rnam pa gsum pa la ni chos bstan kyang don med cing chud zos pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar nyan pa'i skye bo rnam pa gsum pa la ni chos bstan kyang don med cing chud zos pa nyid yin te /
translated: In the same way, even if the teaching is presented to the three kinds of listeners, it is wasted and does not accomplish its purpose.

original: gang du thos pa bya ba g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis mi 'jug pa dang / gang du 'jug tu zin kyang tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang du yang dran pa med pas mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: gang du thos pa bya ba g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis mi 'jug pa dang / gang du 'jug tu zin kyang tshul bzhin du yid la mi byed pas ma rung bar 'gyur ba dang / gang du yang dran pa med pas mi gnas pa'o //
translated: Where it is not applied because of distraction and the two kinds of dullness; where, even if it is applied, it is spoiled by improper mental attention; and where it does not remain because of the absence of mindfulness.

original: gang yon tan 'dod pa'i skye bo zhes smos te /üîΩ'dis ni gang du thos pa mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang yon tan 'dod pa'i skye bo zhes smos te / 'dis ni gang du thos pa mi 'jug ste /
translated: The person who desires virtue is the one who is not distracted and is not dull.

original: g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis skyon med par ston to //
analyzed: g-yeng ba dang / rmugs pa rnam pa gnyis kyis skyon med par ston to //
translated: This shows that the absence of application is due to the two faults of distraction and dullness.

original: yon tan dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yon tan dga' ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The one who delights in virtue is the one who is not dull.

original: yon tan la dga' zhing gzengs bstod pa de ni yon tan la dga' zhing gzengs bstod pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan la dga' zhing gzengs bstod pa de ni yon tan la dga' zhing gzengs bstod pa'o //
translated: The one who delights in virtue and is elated is the one who delights in virtue and is elated.

original: gang zag gang gis yon tan la dga' ba de ni g-yeng ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gang gis yon tan la dga' ba de ni g-yeng ba med pa yin no //
translated: The person who delights in virtue is the one who is not distracted.

original: chos kyi yon tan la dga' ba de ni gnyid dang rmugs pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi yon tan la dga' ba de ni gnyid dang rmugs pa med pa yin no //
translated: The one who delights in the virtues of the teaching is the one who is not dull.

original: mkhas pa rnams kyi go 'phang yin pas na mkhas pa'i thabs te /
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyi go 'phang yin pas na mkhas pa'i thabs te /
translated: The state of the wise is the means of the wise.

original: mkhas pa'i thabs thob pa de dag des so //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i thabs thob pa de dag des so //
translated: Those who have attained the means of the wise have that.

original: phrag dog gi sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la phrag dog gi sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrag dog gi sems bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi phun sum tshogs pa la phrag dog gi sems bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase arousing a jealous attitude means arousing a jealous attitude toward the excellence of others.

original: yon tan gyi khyad par yin pas na yon tan khyad par ro //
analyzed: yon tan gyi khyad par yin pas na yon tan khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase distinctive virtue means a distinctive excellence.

original: yang na yon tan nyid khyad par yin pas yon tan khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang na yon tan nyid khyad par yin pas yon tan khyad par ro //
translated: Or, it means distinctive virtue because virtue itself is distinctive.

original: bdag nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par yin pas rang gi yon tan khyad par ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yon tan gyi khyad par yin pas rang gi yon tan khyad par ro //
translated: The phrase distinctive virtue of one's own means a distinctive excellence of one's own.

original: yang na bdag gi yon tan nyid khyad par yin pas rang gi yon tan khyad par ro //
analyzed: yang na bdag gi yon tan nyid khyad par yin pas rang gi yon tan khyad par ro //
translated: Or, it means distinctive virtue of one's own because one's own virtue is distinctive.

original: de dang ldan pa yin pas rang gi yon tan khyad par can no //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yin pas rang gi yon tan khyad par can no //
translated: The phrase distinctive virtue of one's own means that.

original: des 'gro ba mgu bar nus pa'i mthu sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba mgu bar nus pa'i mthu can no //
analyzed: des 'gro ba mgu bar nus pa'i mthu sbyor ba gang yin pa de ni 'gro ba mgu bar nus pa'i mthu can no //
translated: The phrase the power of being able to please beings means the power of being able to please beings.

original: yon tan bcos mas zhes bya ba ni yon tan bcos ma nyid kyis te /
analyzed: yon tan bcos mas zhes bya ba ni yon tan bcos ma nyid kyis te /
translated: The phrase through the power of a counterfeit virtue means through the power of a counterfeit virtue.

original: des bkur sti thob pa'o //
analyzed: des bkur sti thob pa'o //
translated: The phrase one obtains honor means one obtains honor.

original: de la shin tu 'bar ba nyid yin te 'phel ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la shin tu 'bar ba nyid yin te 'phel ba nyid do //
translated: It is very blazing, that is, it is increasing.

original: phrag @276b dog gi me zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phrag @276b dog gi me zhes bya ba la /
translated: The fire of envy,

original: phrag dog nyid me yin pas phrag dog gi me'o //
analyzed: phrag dog nyid me yin pas phrag dog gi me'o //
translated: envy itself is the fire, thus it is the fire of envy.

original: phrag dog gi me des ni me bzhin du rang gi gnas sreg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phrag dog gi me des ni me bzhin du rang gi gnas sreg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that fire of envy, like fire, one's own abode is burned.

original: rgyal po chos la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i phyir chos la brten pa de'o //
analyzed: rgyal po chos la brten pa zhes bya ba ni rgyal po'i chos dang mi mthun pa'i phyir chos la brten pa de'o //
translated: The king who is devoted to the Dharma, because he is not in accord with the Dharma of kings, is devoted to the Dharma.

original: yon tan la dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gtam gyis so //
analyzed: yon tan la dgyes pa zhes bya ba ni chos kyi gtam gyis so //
translated: Delighting in virtue, by means of the discourse on the Dharma.

original: chos la mngon 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni chos la mngon par phyogs pa ste rjes su dga' zhing 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos la mngon 'tshal nas zhes bya ba ni chos la mngon par phyogs pa ste rjes su dga' zhing 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Having faith in the Dharma, having a tendency towards the Dharma, means delighting in and desiring it.

original: brlag par bgyi ba'i slad du g-yo dang bcas pa'i tshig 'jam por smra zhing spyod pa gang yin pa de ni brlag par bgyi ba'i slad du g-yo dang bcas pa'i tshig 'jam por smra zhing spyod pa'o //
analyzed: brlag par bgyi ba'i slad du g-yo dang bcas pa'i tshig 'jam por smra zhing spyod pa gang yin pa de ni brlag par bgyi ba'i slad du g-yo dang bcas pa'i tshig 'jam por smra zhing spyod pa'o //
translated: The words and conduct that are deceitful for the sake of destruction are the words and conduct that are deceitful for the sake of destruction.

original: brlag pa zhes bya ba ni dpal gang yin pa de nyams par byed pa ste /
analyzed: brlag pa zhes bya ba ni dpal gang yin pa de nyams par byed pa ste /
translated: The destruction is the loss of whatever glory there is.

original: chos nan tan du byed kyang rgyal po ni rlag par byed pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos nan tan du byed kyang rgyal po ni rlag par byed pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even though the Dharma is practiced, the king is the very one who causes destruction.

original: rgyal po'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir brlag pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgyal po'i chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir brlag pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Because it is contrary to the Dharma of kings, it is called destruction.

original: nyams drod ni spyod pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to//
analyzed: nyams drod ni spyod pa la 'jug pa zhes bya ba'i don to//
translated: The warmth is the meaning of the word engagement.

original: de'i rten du gyur pas na nyams drod 'dzin pa lags te /
analyzed: de'i rten du gyur pas na nyams drod 'dzin pa lags te /
translated: Because it is the basis of that, it is called holding the warmth.

original: zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: bya ma rta zhes bya ba ni nyan rna ba'o //
analyzed: bya ma rta zhes bya ba ni nyan rna ba'o //
translated: The listening is the listening to the Dharma.

original: bya ma rta nyid btang ba yin pas bya ma rta btang ba'o //
analyzed: bya ma rta nyid btang ba yin pas bya ma rta btang ba'o //
translated: Because the listening itself is given, it is the giving of listening.

original: thugs rje che ba zhes bya ba la thugs rje ni gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i don du gnyer ba'o //
analyzed: thugs rje che ba zhes bya ba la thugs rje ni gzhan sdug bsngal dang bral ba'i don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: The great compassion is the striving for the sake of others being free from suffering.

original: ngo tsha mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jam des can du gyur te /
analyzed: ngo tsha mkhyen pa nyid kyi 'jam des can du gyur te /
translated: The gentleness is the knowledge of shame.

original: des las la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des las la sogs pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that, the actions, etc., are abandoned.

original: srid dang 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni srid pa dang 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: srid dang 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni srid pa dang 'dod pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: He who is not in accord with existence and desire is not in accord with existence and desire.

original: de yang snying rje dang ldan par bgyi ba'i ched du bgyid pa ste /üîΩde gzhan gyi bran bzhin du byed pas don du sgrub cing gang gzhan gyis brnyas par 'os pa de byed pa ni don sgrub pa nyid du yin no //
analyzed: de yang snying rje dang ldan par bgyi ba'i ched du bgyid pa ste / de gzhan gyi bran bzhin du byed pas don du sgrub cing gang gzhan gyis brnyas par 'os pa de byed pa ni don sgrub pa nyid du yin no //
translated: He does this for the sake of compassion.üîΩHe does what others consider contemptible, and he does it for the sake of accomplishing his purpose.üîΩHe is a skillful friend, and he is a friend who is not contemptible.üîΩHe is a friend who is not contemptible because he does not do what others consider contemptible.

original: ched cher bgyis nas thabs kyis bag 'bebs so //üîΩzhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba med pa'i thabs kyis so //
analyzed: ched cher bgyis nas thabs kyis bag 'bebs so // zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba med pa'i thabs kyis so //
translated: He is a friend who is not deceitful because he does not deceive others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a cheat because he does not cheat others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a flatterer because he does not flatter others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a self-seeker because he does not seek his own end.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a schemer because he does not scheme with others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a betrayer because he does not betray others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.

original: bshes shing 'drul la zhes bya ba ni mdza' bar 'brel pa'o ;üîΩ/ yid mi ches pa dang / brtse ba chung ba gnyis kyis sems sngon dang mi 'dra bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni yid mi ches par gyur te /
analyzed: bshes shing 'drul la zhes bya ba ni mdza' bar 'brel pa'o ; / yid mi ches pa dang / brtse ba chung ba gnyis kyis sems sngon dang mi 'dra bar gyur pa gang yin pa de ni yid mi ches par gyur te /
translated: He is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.

original: byams pa dang bkur sti chung zhes sems sngon dang mi 'dra bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa dang bkur sti chung zhes sems sngon dang mi 'dra bar gyur pa'o //
translated: He is a friend who is not a tormentor because he does not torment others.üîΩHe is a friend who is not

original: dbyen gyi rdo rje nyid ser ba yin te /üîΩde ltung ba ni dbyen gyi @277a * //
analyzed: dbyen gyi rdo rje nyid ser ba yin te / de ltung ba ni dbyen gyi @277a * //
translated: The thunderbolt of dissension is the lightning.

original: ser ba rdo rje 'bab pa'o //
analyzed: ser ba rdo rje 'bab pa'o //
translated: The downfall is the lightning of dissension.

original: mdza' ba brtan pa zhes bya ba ni brtan par gyur pa'i mdza' ba de la phan pa mi 'dod pas smras pa'i dbyen gyi tshig yin te /
analyzed: mdza' ba brtan pa zhes bya ba ni brtan par gyur pa'i mdza' ba de la phan pa mi 'dod pas smras pa'i dbyen gyi tshig yin te /
translated: Firm friendship is the friendship that has become firm. The words of dissension are those that are spoken by one who does not wish to benefit that friendship.

original: sems kyi longs spyod med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi longs spyod med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no enjoyment of the mind.

original: nyams shing zhig par mi 'gyur su zhig yod //
analyzed: nyams shing zhig par mi 'gyur su zhig yod //
translated: Who is there that will not be destroyed and perish?

original: ces bya ba ni gcig kyang med pas thams cad kyang nyams shing zhig par 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni gcig kyang med pas thams cad kyang nyams shing zhig par 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Since there is not even one who will not be destroyed and perish, all will be destroyed and perish.

original: yang na mdza' ba brtan pa ni yid ches pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mdza' ba brtan pa ni yid ches pa'o //
translated: Alternatively, firm friendship is confidence.

original: nyams shing zhig pa ni sngon ji lta ba bzhin du mdza' ba brtan pa'am yid ches pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams shing zhig pa ni sngon ji lta ba bzhin du mdza' ba brtan pa'am yid ches pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The destruction and perishing is the absence of the firm friendship or confidence as it was before.

original: bkur sti chung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni brtse ba dang gus pa chung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bkur sti chung bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni brtse ba dang gus pa chung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Little respect is the lack of affection and reverence.

original: bya ba mang po la brel ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba mang pos brel ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba mang po la brel ba gang yin pa de ni bya ba mang pos brel ba'o //
translated: He who is busy with many activities is one who is busy with many activities.

original: de ltar gyur pa yid la'ang mi byed na //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa yid la'ang mi byed na //
translated: If he does not even pay attention to that,

original: zhes bya ba ni rim gro mi byed par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rim gro mi byed par gyur pa'o //
translated: he does not pay attention to it.

original: de'i drung na gnas pa ni drung na 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i drung na gnas pa ni drung na 'khod pa'o //
translated: He who is in his presence is one who is in his presence.

original: de'i drung na 'khod cing 'khor ba'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni de'i 'khor na 'khod pa rnams so //
analyzed: de'i drung na 'khod cing 'khor ba'i tshul gang la yod pa de ni de'i 'khor na 'khod pa rnams so //
translated: He who is in his presence and is in the manner of a retinue is one who is in the retinue.

original: gus pa dang rim gro ni gus pa dang rim gro'o //
analyzed: gus pa dang rim gro ni gus pa dang rim gro'o //
translated: Respect and attention are respect and attention.

original: de gnyis kyi lhod par gyur pa ni g-yel ba'o //
analyzed: de gnyis kyi lhod par gyur pa ni g-yel ba'o //
translated: The slackness of those two is negligence.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ston pa dang byed pa gnyis tha dad do zhes bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas yin pas dogs pa 'byung ba'i gzhi'o //
analyzed: ston pa dang byed pa gnyis tha dad do zhes bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // dogs pa 'byung ba'i gnas yin pas dogs pa 'byung ba'i gzhi'o //
translated: The teacher and the agent are different.üîΩIt is the basis of the arising of doubt, thus it is the basis of the arising of doubt.

original: nongs par dogs pa 'byung ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni nyes pa 'byung ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nongs par dogs pa 'byung ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni nyes pa 'byung ba'i gzhi zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The basis of the arising of doubt is the basis of the arising of fault.

original: bag med pa nyid nyes pa yin pas bag med nongs pa'o //
analyzed: bag med pa nyid nyes pa yin pas bag med nongs pa'o //
translated: Since heedlessness is a fault, it is the fault of heedlessness.

original: yang na bag med pas nongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bag med pas nongs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is a fault due to heedlessness.

original: 'phral la 'di ltar mi mchi ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'phral la 'di ltar mi mchi ba zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase it is not seen to be like this now indicates that it has a cause.

original: bkur sti chung zhing khros pa'i yid gang yin pa de ni bkur sti chung ba'i sems te de med pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti chung zhing khros pa'i yid gang yin pa de ni bkur sti chung ba'i sems te de med pa'o //
translated: The phrase the mind that is angry and has little respect means that it is absent where there is little respect.

original: 'o na rgyu de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rgyu de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: smras pa / khyod ni chos kyi snod du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / khyod ni chos kyi snod du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is said, You are a vessel for the Dharma, and so forth.

original: de nas rgyal po de'i khyi gnang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni mi ma yin pa khyi yang zug pa'i tshul gyis rgyu yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po de'i khyi gnang chen zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis ni mi ma yin pa khyi yang zug pa'i tshul gyis rgyu yod pa yin te /
translated: Then, the phrase the king's dog named Dƒ´rghayu, and so forth, indicates that even a non-human dog is a cause for the king's anger,

original: dbyen gyi tshul nges bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyen gyi tshul nges bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it shows the way of division.

original: bri bar gyur pa ni yal bar bor ba'o //
analyzed: bri bar gyur pa ni yal bar bor ba'o //
translated: The phrase it has disappeared means that it has been abandoned.

original: gsum po 'di ni bdag gi 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di ni bdag gi 'gro ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: These three are the causes for my going.

original: gnas la lhag par zhen pa dang / gzhan du 'gro ba'i gnas @277b ma mthong ba dang / bsnyen bkur chung bar yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: gnas la lhag par zhen pa dang / gzhan du 'gro ba'i gnas @277b ma mthong ba dang / bsnyen bkur chung bar yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: 1) attachment to a place, 2) not seeing a place to go to, and 3) knowing that service is small.

original: phyis bskrad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni slad kyis bskrad par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: phyis bskrad par 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni slad kyis bskrad par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: That which is later expelled is later expelled.

original: rjes su rgyal pos bskrad pa dang / spyugs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rgyal pos bskrad pa dang / spyugs par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: The king later expels and banishes it.

original: mi dga' ba ni brtse ba gcod pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' ba ni brtse ba gcod pa'o //
translated: Displeasure is the cutting off of affection.

original: mi dga' bas gdungs pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni mi dga' ba bzhin du'o //
analyzed: mi dga' bas gdungs pa'i sems gang yin pa de ni mi dga' ba bzhin du'o //
translated: The mind that is tormented by displeasure is as if displeased.

original: lan cig tsam zhig sma bab gyur pa yis //
analyzed: lan cig tsam zhig sma bab gyur pa yis //
translated: Even if it is just once, it is said to be

original: zhes bya ba ni brnyas par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brnyas par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: despised.

original: sngon chad phan btags zhes bya ba ni phan btags pa mang du byas pa ste /
analyzed: sngon chad phan btags zhes bya ba ni phan btags pa mang du byas pa ste /

analyzed: phyis kyang mnyam du med par byed //

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: sngon gyi las las byas pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'bad pa'i mthus byas pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos pa yin te /

analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi byed pa'i 'gro ba rnams kyi byed pa po gcig tu mi rigs pa nyid de /

analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i dngos po byed par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
